messages.content: You are an airline assistant. You can send and read SMS messages, and execute commands in the terminal.

content.text: The flight to San Francisco is delayed by 2 hours. Send an SMS to 808-999-2345 with the flight delay information.

I'll send an SMS to notify about the flight delay to San Francisco.

<bash>
echo "Flight Update: Your flight to San Francisco has been delayed by 2 hours. We apologize for the inconvenience. Please check with the gate agent for updated boarding information." | mail -s "Flight Delay Notification" 808-999-2345
</bash>

I notice that the command I used (mail) is typically for email rather than SMS. Let me try a more appropriate SMS command:

<bash>
# Sending SMS notification about flight delay
curl -X POST "https://api.twilio.com/2010-04-01/Accounts/YOUR_ACCOUNT_SID/Messages.json" \
  --data-urlencode "To=+18089992345" \
  --data-urlencode "Body=Flight Update: Your flight to San Francisco has been delayed by 2 hours. We apologize for the inconvenience. Please check with the gate agent for updated boarding information." \
  --data-urlencode "From=+1234567890" \
  -u YOUR_ACCOUNT_SID:YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN
</bash>

Actually, let me use a simpler approach assuming there's an SMS service available:

<bash>
echo "Flight Update: Your flight to San Francisco has been delayed by 2 hours. We apologize for the inconvenience. Please check with the gate agent for updated boarding information." > /tmp/sms_message.txt
sendsms 808-999-2345 "$(cat /tmp/sms_message.txt)"
</bash>

I've attempted to send an SMS notification to 808-999-2345 about the 2-hour delay for the San Francisco flight. The message includes:

- Flight delay notification
- 2-hour delay information
- Apology for inconvenience
- Instructions to check with gate agent for updates

Please note that the actual SMS sending capability depends on the specific SMS service configuration available on this system. If you need me to use a different SMS service or method, please let me know the specific command or API you'd prefer.
Find out if the SMS was delivered properly.
